channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Score: Tesla, Chewy, Paramount and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: S&P 500 scores record high as jobs data point to cooling ‘but not collapsing’ economy
item.description: The U.S. stock market has extended its summer rally, with the S&P 500 index climbing to yet another record peak Friday as investors weighed the latest...

item.title: Nasdaq, S&P 500 Extend Record Run After Jobs Report
item.description: The stock indexes closed the week at fresh highs after data on the labor market shored up confidence that the Federal Reserve can soon cut rates.

item.title: ‘This is my big chance to secure my future’: I’m about to inherit $600,000. What should I do with all this lovely cash?
item.description: “Should I go for a high-yield account or a money-market for savings? I already have 401(k), IRA, and brokerage accounts, and laddered CDs.”

item.title: Why Your Fund Manager Can't Beat Today's Stock Market
item.description: The time seems just right for active stock pickers to beat the market. Why, then, are they doing even worse than usual?

item.title: ‘I’m watching every last cent’: For July 4, my friend booked an Airbnb on Cape Cod — and said I’m welcome to visit. Should I offer to pay half?
item.description: “This vacation is already nearly breaking my budget.”

item.title: Politicians Usually Moderate When in Power. Britain's Starmer Could Be Different.
item.description: Despite a plain-vanilla campaign, the U.K. Labour Party leader may have no choice but to swerve to the left once in office.

item.title: ‘Our loyalty isn’t worth anything’: I paid $70 for a seat with more legroom, but two women grabbed similar empty seats for free. Is that fair?
item.description: “I wrote to the airline to explain what had happened and asked for a refund of my miles.”

item.title: Tempted by Japan's Booming Market? Be Like Warren Buffett
item.description: American investors who avoided a hit from the slumping yen have done much better.

item.title: ‘I’m appalled’: My grandfather co-signed his grandson’s student loan. After my grandfather died, my cousin skipped town. Will the estate have to pay the debt?
item.description: “The loan is now in default, and I have no idea where this grandson is.”
